The driver drives to customer location for pick up, and hoists bin onto truck to empty contents using a hydraulic lift. The driver proceeds to subsequent customers until the truck has a full load, and then dumps the load at a transfer station before continuing customer pickups.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Essential Duties and Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Ensure safe operation of a truck, while driving and loading.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Drive to customer location for pickup, and position truck safely to ensure an easy lift.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Hoist bin onto truck and empty contents using hydraulic lift. Voilà les premières valeurs de la compagnie. Nous sommes une entreprise Nord-Américaine et souhaitons agrandir notre équipe de maintenance préventive. Chez Enviro Connexions nous reconnaissons et rémunérons pour la sécurité, la compétence et l’attitude. Nous avons un des meilleurs plan de rémunération dans l’industrie. Nous recherchons les meilleurs.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Nous sommes une équipe d’une vingtaine de mécanicien. <p>Waste Connections of Canada is looking for a SAFETY inclined, energetic, autonomous, and proactive Operations Supervisor. They will be leading our team of amazing garbage truck drivers at the Ottawa, ON district. As a Operations Supervisor, you will be responsible for managing all Drivers on a daily basis. You will ensure that operations are running safely, by performing Driver observations and monthly safety meetings. This role is a leadership position of our Collections business unit. The key responsibilities will be to ensure that safety, compliance, customer service, growth, sales and financial targets are met on a consistent basis. Your demonstration of leadership skills, along with your personal and ethical behavior is of paramount importance in this position.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Oversee day-to-day operations of multiple routes.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Reviews daily route sheets for P&amp;L statistical information.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Performs operational audits of collections routes and observation routes.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure that Drivers required to operate company vehicles or equipment are completing daily safety and maintenance checks.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinates with Dispatcher to ensure deliveries, exchanges and repairs are completed in a timely manner.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Plans, monitors employee schedules, and route scheduling including regular communication throughout the day until all routes are completed.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Performs Interviewing, selection and training of potential new hires.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Performance Management of employees through the progressive discipline process.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Conducts incident investigations including scene management, first incident report and final analysis with root cause and preventative measures.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintains Environmental Health and Safety programs including training, meetings and required reporting of relevant EH&amp;S issues.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintaining adherence to company safety policies and DOT regulations.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p> Requirements:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> High school diploma or equivalent.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Prior lead person or supervisory experience is preferred.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must possess or be willing to obtain a valid DZ driver’s license or higher grade, and pass all DOT regulations.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience operating various refuse collection equipment is an asset.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Data entry and analysis is necessary.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must be Safety first minded.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Individual should demonstrate initiative and self-motivation.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p> What’s In It for You?<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p> You will be joining a team environment and colleagues who embrace a “work hard, play harder” culture. Our compensation package is competitive, and comes with excellent benefits, including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, RRSP plans. You’ll also be associating yourself with a company that likes to lead by example, through a strong presence in our local communities, charitable giving, sustainability initiatives and more.<\u002Fp>\n This role will serve as the resident expert for this small but busy office. Items that will fill your day include: scheduling and dispatching multiple commercial Drivers for waste collection. Coordinating drivers according to customer requests and company rules, communicates with customers to determine driver needs, schedules and notifies divers of assignments. You will be the first line of communication to ensure daily pick-ups are completed, and resolve issues that impede progress.<\u002Fp>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p><br> to appropriate waste collection routes<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Updates and maintains all assigned line of business routes in TRUX system<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Prints and disperses route sheets to drivers as needed, timely closure of routes to enable accurate billing.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Serves as a single point of contact for all internal and external customers<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Respond to customer inquiries – via phone and email and resolve customer billing problems through account corrections<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Liaise <p><b><i>Experienced **Front End Garbage Truck Driver** with $27.79 as starting rate<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><i> If you are looking for a great place to work, a change from for drivers to help shape our organization into one of the premier waste companies in North America. <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Position Summary<\u002Fb> <\u002Fp>\n <p>The Driver ensures safe operation of a truck, while driving, loading\u002Funloading. The driver drives to customer location for pick up, and hoists bin onto truck to empty contents using a hydraulic lift. The driver proceeds to subsequent customers until the truck has a full load, and then dumps the load at a transfer station before continuing customer pickups. <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Essential Duties and Responsibilities<\u002Fb> <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Ensure safe operation of a truck, while driving and loading.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Drive to customer location for pickup, and position truck safely to ensure an easy lift.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Hoist bin onto truck and empty contents using hydraulic lift. (Note: for side load, roll bins and hook on side of truck to lift)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure customer satisfaction through reliable service.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Complete special pickups, as requested by Dispatcher.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Dump contents at designated transfer station or landfill.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Drive to transfer station to weigh vehicle.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide run sheet to Dispatch to sequence run in TRUX.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Pre and Post trip inspections.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Document any concerns to be checked by mechanic and complete VCR.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p> Minimum Requirements <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Must have a valid Class 3 or 1 MB Drivers license<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must be able to supply steel toe boots.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Capable of problem solving, critical thinking, job task planning, map\u002Faddress reading, organizing and significant use of memory.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must be able to successfully complete a criminal record check and drug test.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must be able to supply a clean, commercial driver abstract.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Work Conditions and Physical Capabilities<\u002Fb> <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Fast paced environment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Able to perform physical labor including pushing, pulling, reaching above and below shoulder, standing, stooping, crouching, bending and carrying over 50 lbs.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Work performed outdoors in all weather conditions.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Guaranteed 10-hour shift\u002Fday<\u002Fli>\n  <li> This is not a “just driving” job. <div>\n  <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>At Waste Connections of Canada, we focus on SAFETY all day every day for our employees and our community. We are looking for a Residential Driver to service or London, ON location. The Driver ensures safe operation of a truck, while driving and loading through densely populated residential areas. The driver drives his\u002Fher route making constant stops to pick up and place materials into the truck. The driver will proceed along their assigned route until the truck is loaded, and then will proceed to a designated transfer station, usually once a day.<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Essential Duties and Responsibilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <ul>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Ensure safe operation of a Residential collections truck.<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Drive daily assigned residential areas\u002Fmaps for: waste, recycling, organics, or Yard waste curbside collection.<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Ensure customer satisfaction through reliable, consistent service.<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Resolve blocked access, if possible, (e.g. Contact Route Supervisor).<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Complete additional pickups if necessary as directed by Route Supervisor.<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Drive to transfer station to weigh vehicle (weigh in and out), obtain a ticket for weight and record on route sheet.<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Unload contents by moving blade forward, using safe procedures; manually clean out debris trapped behind blade, and return blade to front of truck.<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Complete assigned route and fill out route sheet at end of day.<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> At the start and end of each shift, complete a thorough circle check of truck, review safety issues, tires, lights, fuel, check oil and coolant levels, etc., document any concerns to be checked by maintenance and submit VCR<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Requirements and <p>Waste Connections of Canada is looking for a SAFETY inclined, energetic, autonomous, and proactive Operations Supervisor. They will be leading our team of amazing garbage truck drivers at the Ottawa, ON district. As a Operations Supervisor, you will be responsible for managing all Drivers on a daily basis. You will ensure that operations are running safely, by performing Driver observations and monthly safety meetings. This role is a leadership position of our Collections business unit. The key responsibilities will be to ensure that safety, compliance, customer service, growth, sales and financial targets are met on a consistent basis. Your demonstration of leadership skills, along with your personal and ethical behavior is of paramount importance in this position.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Oversee day-to-day operations of multiple routes.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Reviews daily route sheets for P&amp;L statistical information.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Performs operational audits of collections routes and observation routes.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure that Drivers required to operate company vehicles or equipment are completing daily safety and maintenance checks.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinates with Dispatcher to ensure deliveries, exchanges and repairs are completed in a timely manner.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Plans, monitors employee schedules, and route scheduling including regular communication throughout the day until all routes are completed.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Performs Interviewing, selection and training of potential new hires.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Performance Management of employees through the progressive discipline process.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Conducts incident investigations including scene management, first incident report and final analysis with root cause and preventative measures.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintains Environmental Health and Safety programs including training, meetings and required reporting of relevant EH&amp;S issues.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintaining adherence to company safety policies and DOT regulations.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Requirements:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> High school diploma or equivalent.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Prior lead person or supervisory experience is preferred.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must possess or be willing to obtain a valid DZ driver’s license or higher grade, and pass all DOT regulations.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience operating various refuse collection equipment is an asset.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Data entry and analysis is necessary.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must be Safety first minded.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Individual should demonstrate initiative and self-motivation.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p> What’s In It for You?<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p> You will be joining a team environment and colleagues who embrace a “work hard, play harder” culture. Our compensation package is competitive, and comes with excellent benefits, including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, RRSP plans. You’ll also be associating yourself with a company that likes to lead by example, through a strong presence in our local communities, charitable giving, sustainability initiatives and more.<\u002Fp>\n incentives!<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p> As a Roll off Driver, you are responsible for waste and recycling collection services for various businesses. <p>Enviro Connexions, chef de file en gestion des matières résiduelles non dangereuses en Amérique du Nord, est à la recherche d'un(e) Aide Opérateur(trice) pour notre usine de biométhane, énergique et autonome pour se joindre à son équipe située au Complexe Enviro Connexions à Terrebonne. Nous recherchons une personne déterminée, pour qui la sécurité est primordiale, et qui assurera le soutien de nos opérations tout en renforçant nos valeurs fondamentales d’entreprise.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p> Les objectifs de ce poste sont les suivantes :<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li><p> Veillez de manière que l'usine ne subisse pas d'arrêts imprévus;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p> Assurer de suivre et améliorer les procédures de travail en place; et,<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p> Contributeur à notre culture de santé et sécurité sans incident depuis 6 ans.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p> Le\u002Fla candidat(e) retenu(e) aura l'opportunité de grandir et d'élargir son rôle et ses responsabilités chez Enviro Connexions.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p> Le (la) titulaire du poste travaillera principalement à l’usine de biométhane. Le (la) candidat(e) doit faire preuve d'autonomie, polyvalence, dynamisme, et doit aimer travailler en équipe. Il (elle) a aussi besoin d’avoir une bonne force physique, aimer travailler manuellement à l’extérieur occasionnellement et ce, à diverses conditions climatiques.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p> Relevant du directeur des opérations de l’usine de biométhane de Complexe Enviro Connexions, le poste sera basé à Terrebonne, au Québec. Le candidat(e) aura un horaire du travail de 8 heures entre 5h00 et 18h00. Le télétravail n’est pas possible avec ce poste.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Rôles et responsabilités:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li><p> Assurer le fonctionnement de machines fixes et auxiliaires tels que des générateurs, compresseurs, pompes et tout autre équipement rotatif;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p> Surveiller et inspecter les équipements de l’usine de production de biométhane par le biais des stations HMI, des alarmes, et d’instruments divers tels que des indicateurs de pression, température, débit, niveau et autres paramètres de procédé;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p> Être en mesure d’analyser et de diagnostiquer les paramètres d’opération afin de détecter et de prévenir tout bris mécanique;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p> Être proactif et intervenir de façon anticipative sur des problèmes potentiels d’opération dans le but d’éviter des arrêts de production;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p> Participer aux travaux d’entretien préventifs des équipements;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p> Compléter et maintenir les registres d’intervention spécifiques à chaque équipement (listes de vérifications, pièces remplacées, travaux réalisés);<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p> Être en mesure de lire et d’interpréter des schémas électriques et d’assemblage d’équipements;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p> Veiller au fonctionnement continu et au rendement optimal des opérations de l’usine de production de biométhane; et,<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p> Toutes autres tâches requises par la direction.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li><p> Diplôme en électromécanique<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p> Minimum 2 ans d’expérience dans un emploi similaire<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p> Détenir un permis de conduire valide<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p> Français et anglais parlé et écrits<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p> Capacité de travailler en équipe<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p> Être sur appel à intervalles réguliers<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p> Connaissances de bases des circuits électriques et de contrôles seraient un atout<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p> Maîtrise de Maximo ou autre logiciel de GMAO seraient un atout<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p> Suite MS Office<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Avantages<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p> Vous travaillerez dans une équipe où tous s'efforcent de faire de notre entreprise un super endroit où travailler. Notre programme de rémunération est compétitif et comprend d'excellents avantages sociaux, notamment des plans médicaux, dentaires et d'assurance-vie et de même que des régimes de retraite et de REER. <p>Waste Connections of Canada, the leader in non-hazardous solid waste management in North America is looking for an <b>Operations Manager<\u002Fb> to join our team in <b>Surrey, BC<\u002Fb> We are looking for an SAFETY inclined, energetic, autonomous and proactive team player capable of making a difference in his\u002Fher team and community.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p> Our Surrey, BC Hauling district, has an immediate opening for an <b>Operations Manager <\u002Fb>to lead its team of Commercial Hauling line of business. The Operations Manager will have about <b>4 supervisors, 4 dispatchers and 67 drivers. <\u002Fb>The operations manager will oversee around <b>63<\u002Fb> routes, as well as to cross train with the districts Commercial Front End\u002FRoll-Off Routes and Scheduling.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Summary of Functions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> The Operations Manager plans and manages district operations effectively, ensuring the best possible service metrics are achieved. The Manager sets the tone for safety practices and ensures the team understands and follows the rules of safety which allows for success and protection of employees as well as the community at large. The Manager directs the operations team and drivers to minimize the number of missed pickups, maximize service quality, and minimize drive times while routing to a cost-effective transfer station or landfill.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Essential Duties and Responsibilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Track service metrics and seek opportunities for overall improvement by route.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Implement improvement initiatives (e.g., send supervisor with the driver on weaker performing routes to identify service inefficiencies and opportunities to add density for sales).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Drive safety initiatives and engage the team in a proactive accident avoidance plan.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Fine-tune schedules for route optimization.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Continually adjust routes and boundaries (e.g., review earlier start times, by-laws, busy streets, gated calls).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Handle all employee relations issues with drivers proactively and resolve any grievances.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Hire and discipline drivers and handle major or recurring performance issues directly.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide safety training and address supervisor’s field observations (with retraining, coaching or corrective action on identified issues). May investigate issues or conduct on road and provide oversight of drivers.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Work with the Maintenance Manager to keep all trucks productive, safe and operational.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Manage costs by optimizing labour hours and carryovers.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Investigate and address escalated customer service concerns, and delegate follow-up (e.g., supervisor may go on-site to address issues, e.g. blocked access, illegal dumping).<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> 5 years managing a diverse team in an operations or production, heavy construction\u002Froad building and\u002For environmental field services.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent interpersonal and communication skills and, employee management skills; <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Proven ability to minimize safety-related accidents and operate an accident-free environment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Solid analytical skills to optimize routes and productivity.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Well-developed influencing and presentation skills.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience with collective bargaining agreements (CBA) and grievance handling.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Understand the geographic area and can apply routing principles.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Working knowledge of routing software<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Understand the basics of trucks and maintenance.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Class 3 with Air endorsement will be considered an asset.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Understanding of P&amp;L, budget and forecast management is an asset.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Good knowledge of MS Office (in particular Excel) and other technology related to landfill management.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> What's in it for you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> You will be joining a company with great operating values and colleagues who embrace a “work hard, play harder” culture. <div>\n  <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>At Waste Connections of Canada, we focus on SAFETY all day every day for our employees and our community. We are looking for a Residential Driver to service or London, ON location. The Driver ensures safe operation of a truck, while driving and loading through densely populated residential areas. The driver drives his\u002Fher route making constant stops to pick up and place materials into the truck. The driver will proceed along their assigned route until the truck is loaded, and then will proceed to a designated transfer station, usually once a day.<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Essential Duties and Responsibilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <ul>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Ensure safe operation of a Residential collections truck.<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Drive daily assigned residential areas\u002Fmaps for: waste, recycling, organics, or Yard waste curbside collection.<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Ensure customer satisfaction through reliable, consistent service.<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 weight and record on route sheet.<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Unload contents by moving blade forward, using safe procedures; manually clean out debris trapped behind blade, and return blade to front of truck.<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Complete assigned route and fill out route sheet at end of pm.<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Capable to work up to 10 hours per day.<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience <p><b><i>Experienced **Front End Garbage Truck Driver** with $27.79 as starting rate<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><i> If you are looking for a great place to work, a change from operation of a truck, while driving, loading\u002Funloading. The driver drives to customer location for pick up, and hoists bin onto truck to empty contents using a hydraulic lift. The driver proceeds to subsequent customers until the truck has a full load, and then dumps the load at a transfer station before continuing customer pickups. <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Essential Duties and Responsibilities<\u002Fb> <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Ensure safe operation of a truck, while driving and loading.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Drive to customer location for pickup, and position truck safely to ensure an easy lift.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Hoist bin onto truck and empty contents using hydraulic lift. (Note: for side load, roll bins and hook on side of truck to lift)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure customer satisfaction through reliable service.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Complete special pickups, as requested by Dispatcher.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Dump contents at designated transfer station or landfill.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Drive to transfer station to weigh vehicle.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide run sheet to Dispatch to sequence run in TRUX.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Pre and Post trip inspections.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Document any concerns to be checked by mechanic and complete VCR.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p> Minimum Requirements <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Must have a valid Class 3 or 1 MB Drivers license<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must be able to supply steel toe boots.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Capable of problem solving, critical thinking, job task planning, map\u002Faddress reading, organizing and significant use of memory.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must be able to successfully complete a criminal record check and drug test.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must be able to supply a clean, commercial driver abstract.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Work Conditions and Physical Capabilities<\u002Fb> <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Fast paced environment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Able to perform physical labor including pushing, pulling, reaching above and below shoulder, standing, stooping, crouching, bending and carrying over 50 lbs.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Work performed outdoors in all weather conditions.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Guaranteed 10-hour shift\u002Fday<\u002Fli>\n  <li> This is not a “just driving” job. <p>Waste Connections of Canada has an immediate opening for a Bilingual HR Coordinator to support our Human Resources Team at our Region Office in Vaughan Ontario. The Bilingual Human Resources Coordinator supports projects and goals of the HR Department including the areas of learning, operations, analytics, compliance, benefits, and employee relations.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Job Summary:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Report to and work directly with the Human Resource Manager and support needs of HR Team<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assist with auditing and reporting<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Serve as a point of contact for field support<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support internal and external inquiries regarding company policies, procedures, programs and other people matters<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assist the Human Resources team with activities during acquisitions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provides administrative support to events and activities as requested (e.g. booking rooms for bargaining, catering coordination, creating learning packages for participants)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Carries out special projects as assigned and support HR team when time permits<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintains strict confidentiality of all HR and employee related sensitive information<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support engagement platform and annual Servant Leadership Surveys<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Performs related work as assigned<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Bilingualism; French and English (written and spoken) is a requirement for this role as we operate across Canada!<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Working knowledge of the principles and practices of Human Resources Management<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to handle sensitive subject matter with utmost integrity, discretion and confidentiality<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent time management, planning and communication skills.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The ability to exercise initiative and work independently. We pride ourselves on being self-motivated and self-directed!<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong computer skills in Office, Excel, Word, MS365, Teams, Zoom etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to juggle multiple deadlines and contact with internal customers in a poised and professional manner.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to prioritize tasks from multiple stakeholder<\u002Fli>\n  <li> 2+ years’ experience supporting or involvement with HR related functions (e.g. payroll, recruiting, benefits; especially the Leave of Absence process)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> College or University degree or related field experience preferred<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Workday (or other similar HRIS) experience a plus!<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> What’s In It for You?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p> Come join a team environment and colleagues who embrace a \"work hard, play harder\" culture. Our compensation package is competitive and comes with excellent benefits. You’ll also be associating yourself with a company that likes to lead by example through; a strong presence in our local communities, charitable giving, sustainability initiatives and more.
